questions.question: Do you monitor and protect your network boundaries?
questions.context: Your firewall and network security - protecting the perimeter.
questions.examples: Firewall configured and enabled, network monitoring
questions.followUp: What firewall do you use? Is it actively monitored?
questions.discussion: System boundaries include network perimeters and key internal boundaries. Communications are monitored and controlled at these boundaries through firewalls, proxies, and other boundary devices.

questions.question: Do you use publicly available security guidance?
questions.context: Using known bad IP lists, security updates from vendors.
questions.examples: Windows Defender updates, firewall deny lists, threat feeds
questions.followUp: How do security tools get updated? Automatically?
questions.discussion: Organizations should use threat intelligence and security guidance from vendors, government sources, and security communities to enhance boundary protection.
assessmentObjectives: Guidance is implemented in security tools
